channel.title: Chaging recovery partition OS
channel.description: I have a computer with a Windows Vista installation in a recovery partition. I want to change that vista installation for something like Ubuntu or Windows 7, and still have the recovery key combination at startup boot from this partition. Is this possible? or are recovery installation images different from normal installation images? Has anyone tried doing this before?

item.title: Chaging recovery partition OS
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:3, topic:425933”][quote author=t4 link=topic=528625.msg3855366#msg3855366 date=1324320481]
use something like acronis and burn to a DVD
[/quote]

Burn the factory image?
I already have the OS I want to put as the factory image on a CD, I want to copy it from the CD and place it in the factory image partition as the new factory image.[/quote]
oh, the utility they have is proprietary. keep the image on a CD/external drive or just in another partition.

Read full topic
